member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.FileExistsResolveAction
member.summary: Specifies actions to resolve file existing issue.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileExistsResolveAction.Confirm
member.summary: Raise the event to confirm next action on an existing file. By handling the event, the program will be able to let user decide whether the existing files will be overwritten.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileExistsResolveAction.Skip
member.summary: Skip existing files.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileExistsResolveAction.Overwrite
member.summary: Overwrite existing files without confirmation.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileExistsResolveAction.OverwriteOlderFiles
member.summary: Overwrite existing files without confirmation if they are older than source files. If the File System is SFTP or FTP, using this mode is not recommended because modification dates are often misreported by FTP and SFTP servers, making this mode unreliable. We strongly recommend to use the mode and set the property to a file comparer or develop a custom solution by handling the event. Make sure your system time is synchronized with the destination file system/server. If the source or destination file system is and the time differs (e.g. different timezone), specify a timezone offset in the property.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileExistsResolveAction.OverwriteFilesWithDifferentSizes
member.summary: Overwrite existing files with different sizes. The destination file will be overwritten without confirmation if it is different to the source file in length.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileExistsResolveAction.CustomCompare
member.summary: Use to compare source and destination files. If the method returns true, the existing will be skipped; otherwise it will be overwritten.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileExistsResolveAction.ResumeFileTransfer
member.summary: Resume file transfer. Not available in file move mode. If the destination file size is less than the source file size, the component will resume file transfer. If there is no difference in file length, the destination file wont be overwritten. If the destination file size is greater than the source file size, the destination file will be overwritten.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.RecursionMode
member.summary: Specifies options to scan subdirectories for files and directories to transfer, move, delete, set attributes, set permissions, or search.

remarks.p:
None mode:
The component only searches for files in the first level of the target directory. Subdirectories are not processed.

Recursive mode:
If a file matches the search conditions, the file is processed.
If a directory found, all files that match the search conditions in that directory are processed and the component continues searching for files in its subdirectories.

For example we have folder named /my dir. In that folder we have 'dir.tmp' and 'dir2.tmp' folders and 'file.tmp' file. In 'dir.tmp' folder we have 'dir.file1.tmp' and 'dir.file2.dat'. In 'dir2.tmp' folder we have 'dir2.file1.tmp' file.

Directory structure:
/my dir
-- dir.tmp
---- dir.file1.tmp
---- dir.file2.dat
-- dir2.tmp
---- dir2.file1.tmp
-- file.tmp
If you wish to process files and directories that have name ending with '.tmp' in '/my dir' path, you can use "*.tmp" search pattern or the with "*.tmp" as the search pattern parameter.

Deletion Scenario:
The result with the option is that file 'dir.file1.tmp' in 'dir.tmp' is deleted, dir.file2.dat is not deleted.
Folder 'dir.tmp' matches the search conditions but is not deleted since it's not empty because it still has 'dir.file2.dat' file.
File 'dir2.file1.tmp' is deleted. Then 'dir2.tmp' folder is deleted as well since 'dir2.tmp' is empty after file 'dir2.file1.tmp' has been deleted. 'dir2.tmp' is not deleted if the search conditions exclude directories (i.e with ((.Directory)))
'file.tmp' in 'my dir' is deleted.

Set LastWriteTime, Attributes, or Permissions:
The result with the option is that file 'dir.file1.tmp' in 'dir.tmp' is set, dir.file2.dat is not set.
Folder 'dir.tmp' is set as well.
File 'dir2.file1.tmp' is set. 'dir2.tmp' folder is set as well. 'dir.tmp' and 'dir2.tmp' are not set if the search conditions exclude directories.
'file.tmp' in 'my dir' is set.

SubFoldersMatchingSearchCondition mode:
The component only searches for files in the directories that match the search condition.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.RecursionMode.None
member.summary: Searches for files and directories in the first level only. Subdirectories are not processed.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.RecursionMode.Recursive
member.summary: Searches for directories, subdirectories, and files recursively.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.RecursionMode.SubFoldersMatchingSearchCondition
member.summary: Recurses into subfolders that match the search condition to search for files to transfer or process.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem.MoveFiles(System.String,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves files that match the search condition specified in the parameter from the specified directory to the destination directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The path of the directory containing files and subdirectories to move. If it's empty, the current directory path of the file system will be used. When the parameter is null reference, this can contains wild card masks. For example, "/myremotedir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in '/myremotedir' will be moved, "/myremotedir" means all files in '/myremotedir' will be moved. For more details, see and the option .

The list of file names or objects containing information of files to move (i.e string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" }), or null to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the option parameter.
The path of the destination directory.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A list of source and destination file systems used for the file transfer.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified file exists.
member.param: The file to check.
member.returns: true if the caller has the required permissions and path contains the name of an existing file; otherwise, false. This method also returns false if path is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), an invalid path, or a zero-length string. If the caller does not have sufficient permissions to read the specified file, no exception is thrown and the method returns false regardless of the existence of path.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.IO.TimeComparisonGranularity
member.summary: Specifies granularity for time comparisons.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeComparisonGranularity.None
member.summary: Time is taken as is.
member.remarks: Useful when working with NTFS file system.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeComparisonGranularity.Seconds
member.summary: The smallest time unit is one second (milliseconds are ignored). E.g. 11:33:55.999 is rounded to 11:33:55.000.
member.remarks: Useful when working with some UNIX FTP or SFTP servers.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeComparisonGranularity.TwoSeconds
member.summary: The smallest time unit is two-second. So odd seconds are rounded to lower even value (milliseconds are ignored). E.g. 11:33:55.999 is rounded to 11:33:54.000.
member.remarks: Useful when working with FAT file system (.NET CF, MS-DOS).

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeComparisonGranularity.Minutes
member.summary: The smallest time unit is one minute. Seconds and milliseconds are ignored. E.g. 11:33:55.234 is rounded to 11:33.
member.remarks: Useful when working with some UNIX FTP or SFTP servers.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TimeComparisonGranularity.Days
member.summary: The smallest time unit is one day (time component is ignored). E.g. 2012-12-12 11:33:55.999 is rounded to 2012-12-12 00:00:00.000.
member.remarks: Useful when working with some UNIX FTP or SFTP servers.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.MultiFileOperationOptions.BuildDirectoryTree
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to retrieve directory structure before the multi-file operation (i.e transferring or deleting multiple files and directories).
member.remarks: Setting this option to true makes , , , and available when handling the event. The directory structure information retrieval may take time.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.MultiFileOperationOptions.RetainFileList
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to retain the list while executing the operation and after it completes, making it possible to access information of all files.
member.value: true to retain the list; otherwise false.
member.remarks: By default this property is false to minimize memory footprint while executing the operation. By setting this property to true, the operation will need some extra memory. When processing many files (i.e. 100k files) you may consider leave this property as default to reduce memory needed to store the list.

member.summary: Specifies source file system's authentication parameters. This option is for remote file system, including FTP, SFTP, and SCP file systems only.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.MultiFileOperationOptions.SearchConditionCombinedWithMasksInSourcePath
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to combine (AND logical operator) the wildcard masks found in the source path method parameter with the property in this transfer option object.

remarks.p: If the source path does not contain wildcard masks, this field is ignored.

If the source path contains wild card masks, and this field is set to true, then the AND logical operator is used; otherwise if this field is set to false, the OR logical operator is used. For example, in a call to the , you specify "C:\temp\*.tmp" as the source path and your is (.Hidden). If this field is true, the will search for all hidden files with .tmp extensions; false means the will search for files with .tmp extensions or with hidden attributes.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.FileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified file exists.
member.param: The file to check.
member.returns: true if the caller has the required permissions and path contains the name of an existing file; otherwise, false. This method also returns false if path is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), an invalid path, or a zero-length string. If the caller does not have sufficient permissions to read the specified file, no exception is thrown and the method returns false regardless of the existence of path.

member.returns: true if the caller has the required permissions and the directory contains at least one file that matches the specified search condition; otherwise, false.

members.member:
Deletes the specified directory and, if indicated, any subdirectories and files matching the specified search condition in the directory.
This method does not build directory hierarchy before starting the operation. The name of the directory to remove. Indicates whether the library will delete files in the first level directory only, files in the first level directory and all its subdirectories, or files in the first level directory and its subdirectories matching the . The search conditions to match against the files. (null for searching all files). true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.
is null reference (Nothing in VB.NET). contains illegal path characters. An error occurred while deleting the directory.

true to remove empty directories; otherwise, false.
true to build directory hierarchy to show progress of the entire operation before deleting; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.IFileSystem.MoveFiles(System.String,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves files that match the search condition specified in the parameter from the specified directory to the destination directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The path of the directory containing files and subdirectories to move. If it's empty, the current directory path of the file system will be used. When the parameter is null reference, this can contains wild card masks. For example, "/myremotedir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in '/myremotedir' will be moved, "/myremotedir" means all files in '/myremotedir' will be moved. For more details, see and the option .

The list of file names or objects containing information of files to move (i.e string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" }), or null to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the option parameter.
The path of the destination directory.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A list of source and destination file systems used for the file transfer.

For more details, see and the option .
The path of the destination directory.

The search string to match against the names of files in path. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path and wildcard (* and ?) characters, but doesn't support regular expressions.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An object that references the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Downloads files from the specified remote directory that match the search condition specified in the option parameter to the destination directory on the destination file system.
member.param: The path of the remote directory containing files and subdirectories to download. If it's empty, the current directory path of the file system will be used. When the parameter is null reference, this can contains wild card masks. For example, "/myremotedir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" means all .dat, .cs, and .vb files in '/myremotedir' will be downloaded, "/myremotedir" means all files in '/myremotedir' will be downloaded. For more details, see and the option .
The list of objects containing information of files to download, or null to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the option parameter.
The destination file system that receives the files from this remote file system.

The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period of time an operation (sending commands, waiting for responses or time between data buffer transfers) should timeout.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to 60000 (60 seconds). Minimal value is 1000. A value of -1 or 0 indicates that the request does not timeout.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the Encoding used to encode and decode command parameters and server responses.
member.value: The Encoding used to encode and decode command parameters and server responses. Default is Encoding.Default.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.PathNormalization
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to normalize path before any file or directory operation.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.AsciiFileSearchConditions
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of ASCII file extensions.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.ReconnectionMaxRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of retries for reconnection.
member.remarks: By default this value is 0 (the library does not try to reconnect to the server when the connection is lost). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceed this value, the class will report the connection error.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.ReconnectionFailureDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds between failed login attempts for reconnection during a multi file operation.
member.remarks: By default this value is 5000 (5 secs). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceed the , the class will report the connection error.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.ServerTimeZoneOffset
member.summary: This value is used to synchronize the CreationTime and/or LastWriteTime of files after a transfer. Default value is TimeSpan.Zero.
member.remarks: When a file is copied from this file system to another one and the option is enabled, the file's and will be added with this value. Likewise, and of a file that is copied from another file system will be substracted with this value.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.IO.IRemoteFileSystem.RestoreFileProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to restore file properties including and after downloading or uploading if possible.
member.remarks: Use the to adjust the and of the files to be copied.

member.summary: Occurs when the state of the remote file system is changed.

member.remarks: This event is fired when the method is called.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemFeatures.MultipleOperationOnSingleInstance
member.summary: Allows performing multiple operation on single instance simultaneously. , , and SFTP file system supports this feature. A file system having this feature allows you to delete and create directory, delete, copy, and store files simultaneously. It's very useful when uploading/downloading multiple files on parallel.

member.summary: Gets or sets the file comparison method. Default value is . member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemPath.NormalizePath(System.String,System.Char[])
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This will normalize path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if separator characters are '/' and '\' respectively.
member.param: The path to normalize.

The path separator characters. This can be a list of '/' and '\' characters. The first separator in the list will be used to contruct the final path. For remote paths, '/' character is usually used as the first separator.
member.returns: Normalized path.
member.remarks: Separator at the beginning or end of the path will not be removed. Special dirs will not be normalized.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemPath.NormalizePath(System.String,System.Char[],System.Boolean,ComponentPro.OptionValue,ComponentPro.OptionValue)
member.summary: Normalizes a path. This will normalize path like "\my folder\\my sub folder/sub folder/\my file" to "/my folder/my sub folder/sub folder/my file" if separator characters are '/' and '\' respectively.
member.param: The path to normalize.

The path separator characters. This can be a list of '/' and '\' characters. The first separator in the list will be used to contruct the final path. For remote paths, '/' character is usually used as the first separator.
A boolean value indicating whether to normalize special directories like '.' and '..' found in the path. It treats '.' dir as the current directory and '..' as the upper directory.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the end of the path will be removed if present. Yes - to always include the ending separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the last character as it is.

An option value indicating whether a separator at the beginning of the path will be removed if present. Yes - to always include the leading separator, No - to remove if present, Auto - to keep the first character as it is.
member.returns: Normalized path.

member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name.

member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name if it has a different size.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.CheckAndOverwriteOlderFiles
member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name if it is older than the source file. It is not recommended to use this action for remote file systems because modification dates are often misreported by SFTP and FTP servers. Instead, please select other action or handle the event and choose either Overwrite or Skip action instead.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.Rename
member.summary: Use different name specified in the property as the new destination name. The desired name must be set using the property and it must not be empty or a null reference.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.Retry
member.summary: Retry the current operation.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferConfirmNextActions.Skip
member.summary: Skip the current item. No actions will be performed on it.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.BuildingDirectoryStructure
member.summary: Building directory structure. This state is available when the library is retrieving information of directory structure before transferring or processing the directory contents. When the option of a or instance is set to true, the library retrieves the directory hierarchy before transferring or processing the directory contents.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartCopyingFile
member.summary: The current file is about to be copied.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartUploadingFile
member.summary: A file from another file system or content from a stream is about to upload/copy to this remote file system - usually FTP, SFTP, or SCP. This field equals to . When the transfer state is , you can change source file path, destination file path, or skip uploading file in the event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartStoringFile
member.summary: A file from another file system or content from a stream is about to added to this file system - Zip, RealTimeZip, Tar, Tgz, or Gzip. This field equals to . When the transfer state is , you can change source file path, destination file path, or skip storing file in the event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartDownloadingFile
member.summary: A remote file is about to be downloaded to another file system or a stream of data. When the transfer state is , you can change source file path, destination file path, or skip downloading file in the event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartExtractingFile
member.summary: ZIP File system is about to extract a file to another file system or a stream of data. This field equals to . When the transfer state is StartExtractingFile, you can change source file path, destination file path, or skip extracting file in the event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.StartComparingFile
member.summary: The current file is about to be compared with another one in a multi-file transfer or synchronization process. This state is available when file comparer, specified in of the class or of the class, is an instance of a class that inherits the class - or . A folder synchronization is initiated by calling the or method.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.MovingItem
member.summary: A file or directory is being moved while moving files on the same system with set to true. When the transfer state is , you can change source file path and destination file path or skip moving the item in the Progress event handler.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.CopyingDirectory
member.summary: A directory is being copied. You can skip copying the directory by setting the property to true or cancel the whole process by calling the methods.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.CreatingDirectory
member.summary: A directory is being created. You cannot change source file path and destination file path. You can only skip creating an empty directory with this transfer state.

member.summary: Permissions of a file or directory are about to be set.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.IO.TransferState.SettingFileAttribute
